analysis

Class ConvolutionApproximator

  • java.lang.Object
    • analysis.ConvolutionApproximator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionIntf

    public class ConvolutionApproximator
extends java.lang.Object
implements FunctionIntf
    approximates the convolution operator between two functions f and g, defined as $$(f*g)(S) = \int_{-\infinity}^{+\infinity}f(S-x)g(x)dx$$. Notice that this version of the class works using the (parallel) IntegralApproximatorMT, and requires that both functions are smooth over the entire real line in the variable of the convolution, and the integrand of the convolution as a function of x, decays rapidly enough in both directions.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConvolutionApproximator

        public ConvolutionApproximator(FunctionIntf f,
                       FunctionIntf g,
                       java.util.Hashtable params)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        public constructor. The two functions to be convoluted must have the same number of variables. In case of multi-variate functions, the convolution is computed around 1 variable only, around the same values for all the other variables.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf must accept as input double[] or VectorIntf objects.
        g - FunctionIntf must accept as input double[] or VectorIntf objects.
        params - Hashtable the params table may contain the following pairs:
      • <"convolutionapproximator.integrationlowerlimit", Double l> optional, the initial lower limit of the infinite integral involved in the convolution, default is -1.
      • <"convolutionapproximator.integrationupperlimit", Double u> optional, the initial upper limit of the infinite integral involved in the convolution, default is +1.
      • <"convolutionapproximator.varindex", Integer i> optional the index of the variable to be convoluted for the two functions f and g, default is 0 ( i.e. the 1st variable)
      • Also, the following integration-related params may be specified:
      • <"integralapproximator.eps", Double eps> if present specifies the required precision, default is 1.e-6,
      • <"integralapproximator.levelmax", Integer level> if present specifies maximum level of recursion in the Simpson method, default is Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public double eval(java.lang.Object x,
          java.util.Hashtable params)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        evaluates the convolution of the two functions f and g passed in the constructor at the point x[i] where i is the value of the key "convolutionapproximator.varindex" specified in params.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface FunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - Object must be either a double[] or a VectorIntf object (in package popt4jlib).
        params - Hashtable may contain the following pairs:
      • <"convolutionapproximator.varindex", Integer i> optional, where i must be in [0, x.length-1] if x is a double[] else in [0,x.getNumCoords()-1], specifies the variable of the convolution. Default is the first variable.
      • <"convolutionapproximator.eps", Double e> optional, specifies the gap percentage below which if two successive estimations of the double-infinite convolution integral are found, the computation ends, default is 1.e-6.
        • Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getIntegratorTotalCalls

        public int getIntegratorTotalCalls()
        return a statistic of the total calls the integrator has made to the adaptive simpson procedure.
        Returns:
        int
